title.narrative: EVIDENCE ON CHILDREN'S SITUATION

description.narrative: Evidence on the situation of the most vulnerable children is generated and utilized to increase the child-equity focus policies, strategies and scaling up social sectors systems and investments., which contributes to Building Capacity For Evaluation, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Economic And Social Policy General, Environmental Sustainability, Evaluation And Research, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection And Child Poverty. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Evidence and coordination enables government, communities and partners to improve capacity and systems for equity-focused funding, advocacy , policies & legislation, strategies, planning & supply chain management to scale up results for children.

sector.narrative: Administrative data, registers and non-MICS household surveys and censuses
Building evaluation capacity in UNICEF and the UN system
Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Child poverty measurement: support to routine national measurement of monetary and multidimensional child poverty

Contributing to policies reducing child poverty: Poverty reduction strategies, national development plans, engagement with ministries, parliament, international donor and financial organizations, civil society organizations)
Country programme process (including UNDAF planning and CCA)
Stimulating demand for and capacity to use data
